ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Breakout_footprint_definition is a type of provided to support re-use of patterns necessary to adapt a footprint to a design layout. A Breakout_footprint_definition specifies the footprint being adapted as well as the adaptation pattern.

specifies the role of the
for the Breakout_footprint_definition. The reference_footprint is the footprint being adapted to a design layout by the Breakout_footprint_definition.

specifies an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Breakout_footprint_definition is dependent on the existence of the
that specifies the Breakout_footprint_definition as its . There shall be one or more
for a Breakout_footprint_definition. The breakout_traces are the adaptation pattern components. Each component overlaps with a instance in the reference_footprint when the Breakout_footprint_definition is instantiated and the geometry rendered in a design layout.

The
of Breakout_footprint_definition shall be same as location of its reference_footprint.
The domain of the geometry of the Breakout_footprint_definition shall be the same domain as that of the reference_footprint.

Each member of breakout_traces shall have a domain that overlaps with a
in the reference_footprint.

Each member of breakout_traces shall have a domain that overlaps with a
in the padstack inherited from .
A Breakout_footprint_definition_shape_model is a type of .

specifies the role of the
for the Breakout_footprint_definition_shape_model. There shall exist exactly one
for the Breakout_footprint_definition_shape_model.

specifies the role of the
for the Breakout_footprint_definition_shape_model.

The footprint referenced by of reference_shape shall be same footprint as that referenced by
of of Breakout_footprint_definition_shape_model.

ext_description.p: A Footprint_definition is a type of . A Footprint_definition is an explicit geometric pattern that when realized in a manufactured interconnect substrate provides an interface to a discrete component when the substrate and the component are combined in an assembly. The specific properties required in a manufacturing process for the end product help determine properties of the pattern.
ext_description.note: A Footprint_definition uses generic categories when referencing layers and does not contain design specific layer sequences.

example.p: Figure 1 illustrates two categories of integrated circuit footprints. The parameters shown in the illustration could be conveyed using geometric annotation data supported by ISO 10303-1051, but that annotation is optional since this part of ISO 10303 supports explicit geometry data.
Figure 2 illustrates two categories of simple footprints.

ext_description.p:
specifies the role of the
for the Footprint_definition. The reference_package supports the case where traceability is desired to the originating interface requirement. The existence of this attribute does not limit the application of a Footprint_definition to support other components. A is specified to support the general case, rather than the typical case of . The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: All of Footprint_definition shall be of type .
The Footprint_definition shall not be composed of other Footprint_definitions.

A Footprint_definition_shape_model is a type of . A Footprint_definition_shape_model is the planar shape of a . A Footprint_definition_shape_model may reference either a shape of a
or a shape of a
as a causal shape, with which the Footprint_definition_shape_model is to be compatible.

for the Footprint_definition_shape_model. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

for the Footprint_definition_shape_model.

of the associated .
If reference_seating_plane_placement is provided then the relevant model shape shall be a 3 dimensional model.

The reference_seating_plane_placement shall not be provided for a member of Footprint_definition_shape_model when the reference_shape is a two dimensional model. The reference_shape shall not be a two dimensional model when the reference_seating_plane_placement is provided.
If the reference_shape is a two dimensional model then the context of that model shall be the context of this model.

A Package_footprint_relationship_definition is a type of
provided to explicitly define the geometric relationship between a planar shape of a
and a planar shape of a . The
allows an application to archive and exchange many to many relationships between
and
models.

specifies a
that is establishing a common context in which the
model and the
model are related. Each of the two models is independently transformed into the associated_model, with the role of the transforms being to establish the formal relationship.

specifies two Geometric_models, one of which is a planar model for a , and the other is a planar model for a . The models are individually associated to the
and
related to the
by related_elements through a .

ext_description.note:
Taken together, the related_transforms specifies the geometric relationship between geometric elements in a
model to geometric elements in a
model.

is an inverse attribute that specifies that the

The direction of the related and relating attributes differs from an assembly relationship since a
is not an assembly.

model.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: The associated_model shall have a dimensionality of 2.
There shall exist exactly two related_transforms.
